description: This course provides tools and methods for creating new products. The course is intended for students with a strong career interest in new product development , entrepreneurship, and/or technology development. The course follows an overall product design methodology, including the identification of customer needs, generation of product concepts, prototyping, and design-for-manufacturing. Weekly student assignments are focused on the design of a new product and culminate in the creation of a prototype. The course is open to juniors and seniors in SEAS or Wharton.
name: PRODUCT DESIGN

values.comments:
This course focuses on new product and technology development following an overall product development methodology. Students submit assignments weekly and are focused on new product creation, ultimately resulting in a prototype.

One student was “really glad he took the class” even though he didn’t realize how engineering intensive it was.
Students seem to really enjoy this class primarily because of Professor Ulrich’s experience and insight.

Some comments from students mentioned that it really helped to have a mechanical engineering background to excel in the class. Many also wrote that while a good grade requires only a medium amount of work, students that put in the extra effort truly get the most out of the class.
